intro: Guatteria minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories. The plant features elliptical, glossy leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
